text: Harold K. Lonsdale (January 19, 1932 â€“ November 11, 2014) was an American scientist, businessman, and former politician. A Democrat, he ran for United States Senate in the U.S. state of Oregon three times, losing twice in the primaries and once as the Democratic candidate, losing in the 1990 general election to incumbent Mark Hatfield. Lonsdale died in Indio, California from heart failure, aged 82. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:Businesspeople from Oregon Category:Politicians from Oregon Category:Businesspeople from New Jersey Category:Scientists from New Jersey Category:Politicians from New Jersey Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Harry Lonsdale
